      35                 :            : ///
      36                 :            : /// @brief      A help macro to simplify conditional compilation based on mutability.
      37                 :            : ///
      38                 :            : ///             This macro just wraps the SFINAE paradigm and enables compilation only if the
      39                 :            : ///             QUERY_TYPE is mutable. This macro is replaced by RETURN_TYPE in this case. If
      40                 :            : ///             QUERY_TYPE is const, the code following this macro invocation will not be compiled.
      41                 :            : ///
      42                 :            : /// @param      QUERY_TYPE   The query type to be checked for mutability.
      43                 :            : /// @param      RETURN_TYPE  The return type generated if compilation succeeds.
      44                 :            : ///
      45                 :            : #define COMPILE_IF_MUTABLE(QUERY_TYPE, RETURN_TYPE) \
      46                 :            :   template<typename DummyCloudMsgT = QUERY_TYPE> \
      47                 :            :   std::enable_if_t<!std::is_const<DummyCloudMsgT>::value, RETURN_TYPE> \
      48                 :            :

      63                 :            : 
      64                 :            : ///
      65                 :            : /// @brief      This class implements a point cloud message wrapper. Unless otherwise required, use
      66                 :            : ///             the typedefs of this class: PointCloud2View and PointCloud2Modifier. Only use this
      67                 :            : ///             class directly if those typedefs do not provide enough flexibility.
      68                 :            : ///
      69                 :            : /// @details    This class is designed to simplify working with point cloud messages. The idea is
      70                 :            : ///             that it wraps a point cloud message reference allowing for simple access and
      71                 :            : ///             modification. Upon creation, the wrapper checks if the fields of the message
      72                 :            : ///             correspond to the fields generated from the point type provided by the user. If this
      73                 :            : ///             check has passed, then the fields are identical (including the offsets of the
      74                 :            : ///             members) and it is safe to reinterpret the point cloud message as an array of PointT
      75                 :            : ///             points. Note that due to these checks it is relatively expensive (the complexity of
      76                 :            : ///             the checks is around O(n^2) where n is the number of field generators) to create
      77                 :            : ///             this wrapper, thus it should be avoided in very tight scopes. This operation is not
      78                 :            : ///             slow, but is significantly slower than a single element access. It is better to
      79                 :            : ///             create the wrapper once per message in a function scope and batch all the read/write
      80                 :            : ///             operations afterwards.
      81                 :            : ///
      82                 :            : ///             For convenience, there are two typedefs: PointCloud2View and PointCloud2Modifier.
      83                 :            : ///             - PointCloudView<PointT>{msg} wraps a constant point cloud and allows read-only
      84                 :            : ///               access. Modification through this view is impossible.
      85                 :            : ///             - PointCloud2Modifier<PointT>{msg} wraps a mutable message and allows read-write
      86                 :            : ///               access to the underlying data.
      87                 :            : ///             - PointCloud2Modifier<PointT>{msg, new_frame_id} initializes an empty mutable
      88                 :            : ///               message. This constructor is to be used solely to initialize a new message and
      89                 :            : ///               will throw if the point cloud message is already initialized (i.e., has non-zero
      90                 :            : ///               number of fields).
      91                 :            : ///
      92                 :            : /// @warning    This class wraps a raw reference, so the user is responsible to use it in such a way
      93                 :            : ///             that the underlying point cloud message is not deleted before the wrapper.
      94                 :            : ///
      95                 :            : /// @tparam     PointT           Type of point to use for message reading/writing.
      96                 :            : /// @tparam     PointCloudMsgT   Type of point cloud message.
      97                 :            : /// @tparam     FieldGenerators  A tuple of all field generators that allow generating Field structs
      98                 :            : ///                              from members of a PointT struct. See
      99                 :            : ///                              LIDAR_UTILS__DEFINE_FIELD_GENERATOR_FOR_MEMBER for more details.
     100                 :            : ///                              The class provides a sane default value here, but a custom tuple
     101                 :            : ///                              can be generated by the user by using
     102                 :            : ///                              LIDAR_UTILS__DEFINE_FIELD_GENERATOR_FOR_MEMBER if needed.
     103                 :            : /// @tparam     kIsMutable       Define if the point cloud message is mutable. Used to conditionally
     104                 :            : ///                              compile certain functions.
     105                 :            : /// @tparam     AllocatorT       The message allocator type. This allocator type must be rebindable
     106                 :            : ///                              to the PointT allocator through the use of
     107                 :            : ///                              `std::allocator_traits<AllocatorT>::rebind_alloc<PointT>`.
     108                 :            : ///
     109                 :            : template<
     110                 :            :   typename PointT,
     111                 :            :   template<typename AllocatorT> class PointCloudMsgT,
     112                 :            :   typename FieldGenerators,
     113                 :            :   const bool kIsMutable,
     114                 :            :   typename AllocatorT>
     115                 :            : class PointCloudMsgWrapper
     116                 :            : {
     117                 :            :   /// Depending on the provided kIsMutable boolean use the const or a mutable point cloud msg type.
     118                 :            :   using CloudMsgT =
     119                 :            :     std::conditional_t<kIsMutable, PointCloudMsgT<AllocatorT>, const PointCloudMsgT<AllocatorT>>;
     120                 :            : 
     121                 :            :   static_assert(
     122                 :            :     std::is_default_constructible<PointT>::value,
     123                 :            :     "\n\nThe point type must satisfy is_default_constructible trait.\n\n");
     124                 :            : 
     125                 :            :   static_assert(
     126                 :            :     detail::is_specialization<FieldGenerators, std::tuple>::value,
     127                 :            :     "\n\nFieldGenerators must be an std::tuple.\n\n");
     128                 :            : 
     129                 :            :   static_assert(
     130                 :            :     std::is_same<std::decay_t<CloudMsgT>, sensor_msgs::msg::PointCloud2_<AllocatorT>>::value,
     131                 :            :     "\n\nThis class is designed to work with PointCloud2 messages only for now.\n\n");
     132                 :            : 
     133                 :            :   /// Type of the fields entry
     134                 :            :   using FieldNameT = typename sensor_msgs::msg::PointField_<AllocatorT>::_name_type;
     135                 :            :   /// Type of the data entry
     136                 :            :   using DataVectorT = typename sensor_msgs::msg::PointCloud2_<AllocatorT>::_data_type;
     137                 :            : 
     138                 :            :   /// Get the type of the allocator to use with points.
     139                 :            :   using PointAllocatorT = typename std::allocator_traits<AllocatorT>::template rebind_alloc<PointT>;
     140                 :            : 
     141                 :            :   /// Derive a point vector type (usually std::vector<PointT>). Needed in case a different (e.g.
     142                 :            :   /// bounded vector) type used instead and use it for the Point type with the msg Allocator.
     143                 :            :   using PointVectorType =
     144                 :            :     typename detail::derived_point_vector<DataVectorT, PointT>::template type<PointAllocatorT>;
     145                 :            :

     425                 :            :   /// @brief      Reset the message fields to match the members of the PointT struct. The point
     426                 :            :   ///             cloud message is ready for modification after this operation.
     427                 :         25 :   COMPILE_IF_MUTABLE(CloudMsgT, void) reset_msg(
     428                 :            :     const FieldNameT & frame_id,
     429                 :            :     const sensor_msgs::msg::PointCloud2::_fields_type & generated_fields)
     430                 :            :   {
     431                 :            :     // TODO(igor): All these settings can also be specified through some input struct if needed in
     432                 :            :     // the future. This is omitted for now.
     433                 :         25 :     m_cloud_ref.fields = generated_fields;
     434                 :         25 :     m_cloud_ref.height = 1;
     435                 :         25 :     m_cloud_ref.is_bigendian = false;
     436                 :         25 :     m_cloud_ref.is_dense = false;
     437                 :         25 :     m_cloud_ref.header.frame_id = frame_id;
     438                 :         25 :     m_cloud_ref.point_step = kSizeofPoint::value;
     439                 :         25 :     m_cloud_ref.data.clear();

     441                 :         25 :     m_cloud_ref.row_step = 0U;
     442                 :         25 :   }
     443                 :            : 
     444                 :         14 :   bool check_that_generated_fields_cover_all_point_members(
     445                 :            :     const sensor_msgs::msg::PointCloud2::_fields_type & generated_fields)
     446                 :            :   {
     447                 :         14 :     std::uint32_t sum_of_all_fields_sizes{};
     448         [ +  + ]:         53 :     for (const auto & field : generated_fields) {
     449         [ +  - ]:         39 :       sum_of_all_fields_sizes += field.count * sizeof_field(field.datatype);
     450                 :            :     }
     451         [ +  + ]:         14 :     if (sum_of_all_fields_sizes == kSizeofPoint::value) {
     452                 :            :       // The generated fields cover all members of the struct without gaps.
     453                 :          6 :       return true;
     454                 :            :     }
     455                 :            :     // The idea is the following:
     456                 :            :     // 1. Allocate storage as big as a point.
     457                 :            :     // 2. Fill the storage with zeros.
     458                 :            :     // 3. Iterate through all fields and set the appropriate memory to ones.
     459                 :            :     // 4. Flip all bits - now, if all fields are present, only the padding is non-zero.
     460                 :            :     // 5. Reinterpret this memory as a point.
     461                 :            :     // 6. Compare this point to a value initialized one.
     462                 :            :     // If these points are equal - we have all fields. Otherwise, we are missing a field.
     463                 :            :     alignas(PointT) std::uint8_t buffer[sizeof(PointT)];
     464         [ +  - ]:          8 :     std::fill(buffer, buffer + sizeof(PointT), 0U);
     465         [ +  + ]:         35 :     for (const auto & field : generated_fields) {
     466                 :         27 :       const auto field_first_byte = field.offset;
     467                 :         27 :       const auto field_last_byte =
     468         [ +  - ]:         27 :         field.offset + field.count * static_cast<std::size_t>(sizeof_field(field.datatype));
     469                 :         27 :       std::fill(
     470                 :            :         &buffer[field_first_byte],
     471                 :            :         &buffer[field_last_byte],
     472         [ +  - ]:         27 :         std::numeric_limits<std::uint8_t>::max());
     473                 :            :     }
     474         [ +  + ]:        200 :     for (auto i = 0U; i < sizeof(PointT); ++i) {
     475         [ +  + ]:        192 :       buffer[i] = buffer[i] > 0 ? 0 : std::numeric_limits<std::uint8_t>::max();  // Flip all bits.
     476                 :            :     }
     477                 :          8 :     const PointT * const point_from_flipped_memory{reinterpret_cast<PointT *>(buffer)};
     478         [ +  + ]:          8 :     if (PointT{} == *point_from_flipped_memory) {
     479                 :          7 :       return true;
     480                 :            :     }
     481                 :          1 :     return false;
     482                 :            :   }
     483                 :            : 
     484                 :            :   /// A reference to the cloud message.
     485                 :            :   CloudMsgT & m_cloud_ref;
     486                 :            : };
